normalised: Hey students, stressed about those hefty college fees? Worry not! A new wave of scholarship portals is making education more accessible than ever before. Think of them as the "Amazon" of scholarships, but instead of, say, jhumkas, you're browsing opportunities to fund your B. Tech at I I T Delhi or your B A in History from J N U. These Ed Tech platforms are aggregating scholarships from various sources – government schemes like the P M Scholarship, private trusts like the Tata Trusts, and even international programs. No more endless searching through dusty college notice boards! Many portals even offer personalized recommendations based on your academic record and financial background. Imagine, filtering for scholarships specifically for female students from Uttar Pradesh pursuing medicine! Doctor Sharma, a professor at Mumbai University, says these platforms are a "game changer," helping students from smaller towns access opportunities they wouldn’t have known about otherwise. Some even boast scholarships covering tuition fees, boarding, and even pocket money! Think of the potential savings – maybe enough for that Goa trip with your friends after exams! Now that's a return on investment larger than any two B H K flat around eight hundred square feet in Bandra! Just remember to double-check eligibility criteria before applying. You wouldn't want to end up like Raju from Gurgaon, who applied for a P H D scholarship when he's still in twelfth grade, would you? Good luck, and may the scholarship gods and these portals! be ever in your favor!
